did.unittitle: Josiah Curtis letter, Boston, to Hon. A. Walker, No. Brookfield
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: ALS. Writes that he is fearful of being removed from his office of Superintendent of Registration on the Boston Sanitary Commission as a consequence of his signing a petition requesting a Board of Health. Asks that Walker speak to Secretary of State Warner or Governor Andrew on his behalf. Gives names of others who support his cause. Encloses a copy of a letter from William B. Calhoun, addressed to Warner, arguing his case.
